verbose_text: Following the sequential action of the RNase III enzymes Drosha and DICER, a dsRNA of ~ 22 nt is produced in the cytoplasm, resulting in the formation of the RNA induced silencing complex (RISC) in which only one strand of the dsRNA is inserted that contains members of the Argonaute (Ago) protein subfamily as catalytic endonuclease components.
evidence: ~22 nt is produced in the cytoplasm, resulting in the formation of the RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC
